line.text: My glass shall not persuade me I am old
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: So long as youth and thou are of one date
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: But when in thee time furrows I behold
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Then look I death my days should expiate
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: For all that beauty that doth cover thee
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Is but the seemly raiment of my heart
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Which in thy breast doth live as thine in me
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: How can I then be elder than thou art
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: O therefore love be of thyself so wary
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: As I not for my self but for thee will
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Bearing thy heart which I will keep so chary
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: As tender nurse her babe from faring ill
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Presume not on thy heart when mine is slain
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Thou gav me thine not to give back again
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*
